Detailed Description

Holds category tree and the category translations.

It holds two maps ( category ID -> language -> string ) and ( language -> string -> category id ).

The first one is to translate categories and the second one is for searching in specific languages.

The second map holds converted and sorted words from the categories for quickly finding which categories a given search word is included in.

The tree itself is only a tree of ids, and to get name for each id call getTranslation with the language and optional fallback language.

TODO: No implementation in h-file, only inlines after class. Improve documentation, not too long lines. Cleanup code to follow coding standard.

CategorySet &  matchingCategories,
bool  exactMatch = false,
vector< MC2String > *  noCategoryWords = NULL
)  const
 

Searches for matching categories.

Parameters:
name The name of the categories to match, i.e "rest", matches restaurant, restroom etc.
lang The language to search in.
matchingCategories a vector containing matching categories including all the children.
exactMatch If the name of the categories need to be an exact match.
noCategoryWords If a word is not matched to a category it will be added to this.
Returns:
number of matching categories including the sub categories

IdToSubCategories CategoryTreeUtils::CategoryTree::m_idToChildren [private]
 

a map of category id to its sub categories.

This could as well been a map to the actual node, but that doesn't really matter for the current implementation.

Definition at line 338 of file CategoryTree.h.

CategoryNames CategoryTreeUtils::CategoryTree::m_names [private]
 

Map for category ID -> language -> string ID.

Used to retrieve the name of a category given a category ID and a language. The string ID is an index into m_strings.
